author: benjeyyy
content:
hi <@755590043632140352>, I always had the assumption that ePBS is a cleaner and less complex & invasive change compared to 7886 (which is also mentioned in the ePBS ethmag thread). however, in the delayed execution ethmag thread for Glamsterdam it is stated that ePBS *comes at the cost of added complexity* and *EIP-7886 localizes most complexity within the execution layer ... This design makes it easier to adopt and implement*(compared to ePBS). 
it is a bit contradictory for community members like myself, that are not familiar with the deeper technical details. can we please get some further clarification here?

author: potuz
content:
Yes I think this is a direct disagreement in the complexity of the protocol among the authors of the two EIPs. I think a clear indication that 7886 is more complicated is that
- it involves changes in both layers
- it doesn't separate the block validation of both layers so it keeps this tech debt 
- interaction with other features is much harder: eg FOCIL is trivial on ePBS and hard on 7886. This is due to the previous point
